testCases.explanation: 'a*' means zero or more 'a's, which matches 'aa'
'.*' matches any sequence of characters, including 'ab'

description: Given an input string s and a pattern p, implement regular expression matching with support for '.' and '*'. '.' matches any single character. '*' matches zero or more of the preceding element. The matching should cover the entire input string.

examples.explanation: 'a*' means zero or more 'a's, which matches 'aa'.

constraints: s contains only lowercase English letters
p contains only lowercase English letters, '.', and '*'
It is guaranteed for each occurrence of '*', there will be a previous valid character to match
